channel.title: Comments on: SQL University – SQL Server Reporting Services Configuration Files Overview
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Alex, I haven't attempted that change before, so I'm not sure what to tell you to change. Again, I'd suggest making a backup of the config file, making changes, and testing it - in a development environment first, of course.
item.content:encoded: Alex, I haven’t attempted that change before, so I’m not sure what to tell you to change. Again, I’d suggest making a backup of the config file, making changes, and testing it – in a development environment first, of course.

item.title: By: alex
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes,

An error page returned by the reporting server reveals the exact version of Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services which is installed. Information such as this can be used by an attacker during the reconnaissance stage of an attack (for example, knowing the exact version of the software may help them to exploit a particular vulnerability). Therefore, it is considered good practice to exclude information such as this from HTTP responses.

Unfortunately, I don’t know what to change in the config file…

Thank you!
ALex

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know what removing that would do – I’ve never tried. Why are you trying to hide that information?

As with any change, make a copy of the config file, make your changes, and test what happens.

item.title: By: Alex
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes,
yes, I would like to hide that version number
either “Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services 9.00.4053.00”
or just the version “9.00.4053.00”

moreover, do you know if it is possible to hide the following info as well?
X-powered-By
X-aspNetVersion

Thank you,
ALex

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Alex - I'm not sure I understand what you're asking. You want to edit the file to remove "Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services 9.00.4053.00"?
item.content:encoded: Alex – I’m not sure I understand what you’re asking. You want to edit the file to remove “Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services 9.00.4053.00”?

item.title: By: Alex
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.content:encoded:
HI There,

Is it possible, to have SQL Server Reporting Services configured so that this version disclosure is eliminated?

please, see example below…

HTTP/1.1 500 Server Error
Cache-Control: private
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Server: Microsoft-IIS/6.0
X-Powered-By: ASP.NET
X-AspNet-Version: 2.0.50727
Date: Thu, 20 Dec 2012 10:23:27 GMT
Connection: close
*html* *head*
*title* SQL Server Reporting Services *title*
*meta name=”Generator” content=”Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services 9.00.4053.00″ *
*meta* name=”HTTP Status” content=”500″ *meta* *meta*name=”ProductLocaleID” content=”9″ *meta* *meta*name=”CountryLocaleID” content=”2057″ *meta*

Thank you,
ALex

item.content:encoded: Ev – what are you trying to accomplish?

item.title: By: ev
item.dc:creator: ev
item.description: Can I setup a maintenance plan or automate the log cleanup from a remote server without altering the config files?
item.content:encoded: Can I setup a maintenance plan or automate the log cleanup from a remote server without altering the config files?
